definition: to take the lead
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
early/prior/former/in advance/first

sentences.english: The dude always raced from the front.
sentences.chinese: 这个家伙总是一马当先。

sentences.english: My style is showing leadership through exa good instead of merely words.
sentences.chinese: 我的领导风格是行动先于言谈，一马当先。

sentences.english: Ney drew his sword and placed himself at their head.
sentences.chinese: 内伊拔出了他的剑，一马当先。

sentences.english: Surely, that horse came first bringing him a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 真邪了，那匹马一马当先，他赢了不少钱。

sentences.english: The first to do so were Brazil and Venezuela in 2005.
sentences.chinese: 2005年，巴西和委内瑞拉在这方面一马当先。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold take the lead down to the pit deployment situation.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金一马当先下到坑中调配情况。

sentences.english: With Libya, the president took the lead and the international community followed.
sentences.chinese: 面对利比亚，总统一马当先，国际社会纷纷响应。

definition: to follow closely behind sb or sth (idiom)
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to fight at the head of one's troops/(fig.) to take the lead
to charge
to charge forward
large strides
to take the lead/to be first to start
to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
to charge into
to rush in/to charge in
dauntless/to summon up courage and determination/using extreme force of will
to hurry/to rush/to run quickly/to elope
to go to/to head for/towards
(used in given names)/variant of 奔[ben1]
variant of 奔[ben1]/variant of 奔[ben4]
to take the lead/to be the first/to set an example
to rush out
to charge and break through enemy lines
fast as lightning
